name: India
clues: This country is home to the Taj Mahal, one of the Seven Wonders of the World.
It is known for its diverse cultures, festivals, and spicy food.
It has the second-largest population in the world.

name: Japan
clues: This country is famous for its cherry blossoms and Mount Fuji.
It is known for producing high-quality technology and anime.
Its capital city, Tokyo, is one of the most populated cities in the world.

name: Brazil
clues: This country is home to the Amazon Rainforest.
It has won the FIFA World Cup a record number of times.
It celebrates one of the biggest carnivals in the world.
famous_for: Football, Samba, and the Christ the Redeemer statue

name: France
clues: This country is home to the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre Museum.
It is known for its fashion industry and gourmet cuisine.
It hosts the famous Tour de France cycling race.
famous_for: Wine, Perfumes, and the French Revolution

name: Australia
clues: This country is home to the Great Barrier Reef.
It has unique animals like kangaroos and koalas.
It has a famous opera house in its largest city.

name: Egypt
clues: This country is home to one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
It is known for its ancient civilization and pyramids.
The Nile River, the longest river in the world, flows through it.

name: Canada
clues: This country is the second-largest in the world by land area.
It is famous for maple syrup and ice hockey.
It has beautiful national parks and the Niagara Falls.

name: Germany
clues: This country is known for its engineering and automobile industry.
It is famous for Oktoberfest and sausages.
Its capital city, Berlin, was once divided by a famous wall.

name: China
clues: This country has the Great Wall, one of the longest structures in the world.
It has the highest population in the world.
It is known for its ancient traditions and modern cities like Shanghai.
famous_for: Kung Fu, Pandas, and the Forbidden City

name: United Kingdom
clues: This country is home to the world's most famous royal family.
It has Big Ben, Buckingham Palace, and the River Thames.
Its capital city hosted the Olympics three times.
